# sizeOfLabel(_:)

**Instance Method**

Calculates the size of the receiver’s label.

## Declaration

```swift
func sizeOfLabel(_ computeMin: Bool) -> NSSize
```

## Discussion

If `shouldTruncateLabel` is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], returns the size of the receiver’s full label. If `shouldTruncateLabel` is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], returns the truncated size. If your application does anything to change the size of tab labels, such as overriding the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabViewItem/drawLabel(_:in:)] method to add an icon to each tab, you should override [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabViewItem/sizeOfLabel(_:)] too so the NSTabView knows the correct size for the tab label.

## Related Documentation

- **font**: The font used for the tab view’s label text.

## Working with Labels

- **drawLabel(_:in:)**: Draws the receiver’s label in `tabRect`, which is the area between the curved end caps.
- **label**: Sets the label text for the receiver to `label`.
